channel.title: Publications on Todd Constable
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Todd Constable

item.title: Combining Multiple Behavioral Measures and Multiple Connectomes via Multipath Canonical Correlation Analysis
item.description: Abstract Functional connectomes can successfully predict behavioral measures. While the majority of the literature uses a single connectome to predict a single behavioral measure, there is ample evidence that combining different connectomes and behavioral measures reveals more robust neural correlates.

item.title: A Graph Theory-based Whole Brain Approach to Assess Mood State Differences in Adolescents and Young Adults with Bipolar Disorder
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVES: Identifying hubs of brain dysfunction in adolescents and young adults with Bipolar I Disorder (BDAYA ) could provide targets for early detection, prevention and treatment.

item.title: Genetic variation in endocannabinoid signaling is associated with differential network-level functional connectivity in youth
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Cocaine-dependent individuals demonstrate neural and behavioral differences compared to healthy comparison subjects when performing the Stroop color-word interference test.

item.title: Functional Connectivity during Encoding Predicts Individual Differences in Long-Term Memory
item.description: Abstract What is the neural basis of individual differences in the ability to hold information in long-term memory (LTM)?

item.title: Within node connectivity changes, not simply edge changes, influence graph theory measures in functional connectivity studies of the brain
item.description: Abstract Interest in understanding the organization of the brain has led to the application of graph theory methods across a wide array of functional connectivity studies.

item.title: A hitchhiker’s guide to working with large, open-source neuroimaging datasets
item.description: Abstract Large datasets that enable researchers to perform investigations with unprecedented rigor are growing increasingly common in neuroimaging.

item.title: Transdiagnostic, Connectome-Based Prediction of Memory Constructs Across Psychiatric Disorders
item.description: Abstract Memory deficits are observed in a range of psychiatric disorders, but it is unclear whether memory deficits arise from a shared brain correlate across disorders or from various dysfunctions unique to each disorder.

item.title: Within node connectivity changes, not simply edge changes, influence graph theory measures in functional connectivity studies of the brain
item.description: Abstract Interest in understanding the organization of the brain has led to the application of graph theory methods across a wide array of functional connectivity studies.

item.title: Author Correction: Simultaneous cortex-wide fluorescence Ca(2+) imaging and whole-brain fMRI
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Using functional connectivity models to characterize relationships between working and episodic memory
item.description: Abstract Blood glucose levels influence brain regulation of food intake. This study assessed the effect of mild physiological hyperglycemia on brain response to food cues in individuals with obesity (OB) versus normal weight individuals (NW).

item.title: Brainhack: Developing a culture of open, inclusive, community-driven neuroscience
item.description: Abstract Collaborators: Anousheh N, Arnatkeviciute A, Auzias G, Bachar D, Bannier E, Basanisi R, Basavaraj A, Bedini M, Bellec P, Benn RA, Berluti K, Bollmann S, Bollmann S, Bradley C, Brown J, Buchweitz A, Callahan P, Chan MY, Chandio BQ, Cheng T, Chopra S, Chung AW, Close TG, Combrisson E, Cona G, Constable RT, Cury C, Dadi K, Damasceno PF, Das S, De Vico Fallani F, DeStasio K, Dickie EW, Dorfschmidt L, Duff EP, DuPre E, Dziura S, Esper NB, Esteban O, Fadnavis S, Flandin G, Flannery JE, Flournoy J, Forkel SJ, Franco AR, Ganesan S, Gao S, García Alanis JC, Garyfallidis E, Glatard T, Glerean E, Gonzalez-Castillo J, Gould van Praag CD, Greene AS, Gupta G, Hahn CA, Halchenko YO, Handwerker D, Hartmann TS, Hayot-Sasson V, Heunis S, Hoffstaedter F, Hohmann DM, Horien C, Ioanas HI, Iordan A, Jiang C, Joseph M, Kai J, Karakuzu A, Kennedy DN, Keshavan A, Khan AR, Kiar G, Klink PC, Koppelmans V, Koudoro S, Laird AR, Langs G, Laws M, Licandro R, Liew SL, Lipic T, Litinas K, Lurie DJ, Lussier D, Madan CR, Mais LT, Mansour L S, Manzano-Patron JP, Maoutsa D, Marcon M, Margulies DS, Marinato G, Marinazzo D, Markiewicz CJ, Maumet C, Meneguzzi F, Meunier D, Milham MP, Mills KL, Momi D, Moreau CA, Motala A, Moxon-Emre I, Nichols TE, Nielson DM, Nilsonne G, Novello L, O’Brien C, Olafson E, Oliver LD, Onofrey JA, Orchard ER, Oudyk K, Park PJ, Parsapoor M, Pasquini L, Peltier S, Pernet CR, Pienaar R, Pinheiro-Chagas P, Poline JB, Qiu A, Quendera T, Rice LC, Rocha-Hidalgo J, Rutherford S, Scharinger M, Scheinost D, Shariq D, Shaw TB, Siless V, Simmonite M, Sirmpilatze N, Spence H, Sprenger J, Stajduhar A, Szinte M, Takerkart S, Tam A, Tejavibulya L, Thiebaut de Schotten M, Thome I, Tomaz da Silva L, Traut N, Uddin LQ, Vallesi A, VanMeter JW, Vijayakumar N, di Oleggio Castello MV, Vohryzek J, Vukojević J, Whitaker KJ, Whitmore L, Wideman S, Witt ST, Xie H, Xu T, Yan CG, Yeh FC, Yeo BTT, Zuo XN.

item.title: Resample aggregating improves the generalizability of connectome predictive modeling
item.description: Abstract It is a longstanding goal of neuroimaging to produce reliable, generalizable models of brain behavior relationships.

item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: A guide to the measurement and interpretation of fMRI test-retest reliability
item.description: Abstract The test-retest reliability of functional neuroimaging data has recently been a topic of much discussion.

item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Transdiagnostic, Connectome-Based Prediction of Memory Constructs Across Psychiatric Disorders
item.description: Abstract Memory deficits are observed in a range of psychiatric disorders, but it is unclear whether memory deficits arise from a shared brain correlate across disorders or from various dysfunctions unique to each disorder.

item.title: Brain anatomical covariation patterns linked to binge drinking and age at first full drink
item.description: Abstract Conflict of interest statement: Dr. Potenza has the following disclosures.

item.title: Low-motion fMRI data can be obtained in pediatric participants undergoing a 60-minute scan protocol
item.description: Abstract Performing functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) scans of children can be a difficult task, as participants tend to move while being scanned.

item.title: Corrigendum to Behavioral and brain signatures of substance use vulnerability in childhood [Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience 46 (December) (2020) 100878]
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: A hitchhiker's guide to working with large, open-source neuroimaging datasets
item.description: Abstract Large datasets that enable researchers to perform investigations with unprecedented rigor are growing increasingly common in neuroimaging.

item.title: Structural and functional brain changes in hepatic and neurological Wilson disease
item.description: Abstract Wilson disease (WD) can manifest with hepatic or neuropsychiatric symptoms.

item.title: Behavioral and brain signatures of substance use vulnerability in childhood
item.description: Abstract The prevalence of risky behavior such as substance use increases during adolescence; however, the neurobiological precursors to adolescent substance use remain unclear.

item.title: Simultaneous cortex-wide fluorescence Ca(2+) imaging and whole-brain fMRI
item.description: Abstract Achieving a comprehensive understanding of brain function requires multiple imaging modalities with complementary strengths.

item.title: How Tasks Change Whole-Brain Functional Organization to Reveal Brain-Phenotype Relationships
item.description: Abstract Functional connectivity (FC) calculated from task fMRI data better reveals brain-phenotype relationships than rest-based FC, but how tasks have this effect is unknown.

item.title: Connectome-based models can predict early symptom improvement in major depressive disorder
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is a debilitating mental illness with more than 50% of patients not achieving an adequate response using first-line treatments.

item.title: Altered frontal cortex functioning in emotion regulation and hopelessness in bipolar disorder
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVES: Emotion regulation difficulties precipitate and exacerbate acute mood symptoms in individuals with bipolar disorder (BD), and contribute to suicidal behavior.

item.title: Hippocampal seed connectome-based modeling predicts the feeling of stress
item.description: Abstract Although the feeling of stress is ubiquitous, the neural mechanisms underlying this affective experience remain unclear.

item.title: Identification of a brain fingerprint for overweight and obesity
item.description: Abstract The brain plays a central role in the pathophysiology of overweight and obesity.

item.title: Loss of nucleus accumbens low-frequency fluctuations is a signature of chronic pain
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Connectome-based neurofeedback: A pilot study to improve sustained attention
item.description: Abstract Real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging (rt-fMRI) neurofeedback is a non-invasive, non-pharmacological therapeutic tool that may be useful for training behavior and alleviating clinical symptoms.

item.title: Functional connectivity predicts changes in attention observed across minutes, days, and months
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Cluster failure or power failure? Evaluating sensitivity in cluster-level inference
item.description: Abstract The ability to sustain attention differs across people and changes within a single person over time.

item.title: There is no single functional atlas even for a single individual: Functional parcel definitions change with task
item.description: Abstract The goal of human brain mapping has long been to delineate the functional subunits in the brain and elucidate the functional role of each of these brain regions.

item.title: Extracellular pH mapping of liver cancer on a clinical 3T MRI scanner
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: To demonstrate feasibility of developing a noninvasive extracellular pH (pHe ) mapping method on a clinical MRI scanner for molecular imaging of liver cancer.

item.title: Simultaneous mesoscopic and two-photon imaging of neuronal activity in cortical circuits
item.description: Abstract Spontaneous and sensory-evoked activity propagates across varying spatial scales in the mammalian cortex, but technical challenges have limited conceptual links between the function of local neuronal circuits and brain-wide network dynamics.

item.title: Distributed Patterns of Functional Connectivity Predict Working Memory Performance in Novel Healthy and Memory-impaired Individuals
item.description: Abstract Individual differences in working memory relate to performance differences in general cognitive ability.

item.title: Individualized functional networks reconfigure with cognitive state
item.description: Abstract There is extensive evidence that functional organization of the human brain varies dynamically as the brain switches between task demands, or cognitive states.

item.title: Differential Resting State Connectivity Responses to Glycemic State in Type 1 Diabetes
item.description: Abstract Chronic pain is a highly prevalent disease with poorly understood pathophysiology.

item.title: A decade of test-retest reliability of functional connectivity: A systematic review and meta-analysis
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Once considered mere noise, fMRI-based functional connectivity has become a major neuroscience tool in part due to early studies demonstrating its reliability.

item.title: Image processing and analysis methods for the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study
item.description: Abstract The Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study is an ongoing, nationwide study of the effects of environmental influences on behavioral and brain development in adolescents.

item.title: Combining multiple connectomes improves predictive modeling of phenotypic measures
item.description: Abstract Resting-state and task-based functional connectivity matrices, or connectomes, are powerful predictors of individual differences in phenotypic measures.

item.title: Regions and Connections: Complementary Approaches to Characterize Brain Organization and Function
item.description: Abstract Functional magnetic resonance imaging has proved to be a powerful tool to characterize spatiotemporal patterns of human brain activity.

item.title: An information network flow approach for measuring functional connectivity and predicting behavior
item.description: Abstract INTRODUCTION: Connectome-based predictive modeling (CPM) is a recently developed machine-learning-based framework to predict individual differences in behavior from functional brain connectivity (FC).

item.title: Multivariate approaches improve the reliability and validity of functional connectivity and prediction of individual behaviors
item.description: Abstract Brain functional connectivity features can predict cognition and behavior at the level of the individual.

item.title: Dynamic-flip-angle ECG-gating with nuisance signal regression improves resting-state BOLD functional connectivity mapping by reducing cardiogenic noise
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: To investigate an ECG-gated dynamic-flip-angle BOLD sequence with improved robustness against cardiogenic noise in resting-state fMRI.

item.title: The Functional Brain Organization of an Individual Allows Prediction of Measures of Social Abilities Transdiagnostically in Autism and Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Autism spectrum disorder and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) are associated with complex changes as revealed by functional magnetic resonance imaging.

item.title: What is the Functional Difference Between Sagittal With Metopic and Isolated Sagittal Craniosynotosis?
item.description: Abstract INTRODUCTION: The purpose of this study is to understand the neurological differences between patients born with combined sagittal and metopic craniosynostosis (SMc) and isolated sagittal craniosynostosis (ISc) by studying aberrations in functional brain connectivity and white matter microstructure, before surgery, utilizing functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) and diffusion tensor imaging (DTI).

item.title: Ten simple rules for predictive modeling of individual differences in neuroimaging
item.description: Abstract Establishing brain-behavior associations that map brain organization to phenotypic measures and generalize to novel individuals remains a challenge in neuroimaging.

item.title: Clinical Potential of a New Approach to MRI Acceleration
item.description: Abstract Fast ROtary Nonlinear Spatial ACquisition (FRONSAC) was recently introduced as a new strategy that applies nonlinear gradients as a small perturbation to improve image quality in highly undersampled MRI.

item.title: The individual functional connectome is unique and stable over months to years
item.description: Abstract Functional connectomes computed from fMRI provide a means to characterize individual differences in the patterns of BOLD synchronization across regions of the entire brain.

item.title: Understanding the Learning Disabilities Linked to Sagittal Craniosynostosis
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVE: The purpose of this study is to investigate further findings that corroborate similarities between corrected sagittal craniosynostosis and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

item.title: Multisite reliability and repeatability of an advanced brain MRI protocol
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: MRI is the imaging modality of choice for diagnosis and intervention assessment in neurological disease.

item.title: Insula as the Interface Between Body Awareness and Movement: A Neurofeedback-Guided Kinesthetic Motor Imagery Study in Parkinson's Disease
item.description: Abstract Intentional movement is an internally driven process that requires the integration of motivational and sensory cues with motor preparedness.

item.title: Dynamic functional connectivity during task performance and rest predicts individual differences in attention across studies
item.description: Abstract Dynamic functional connectivity (DFC) aims to maximize resolvable information from functional brain scans by considering temporal changes in network structure.

item.title: Exploring the prediction of emotional valence and pharmacologic effect across fMRI studies of antidepressants
item.description: Abstract INTRODUCTION: In this study, the authors seek to clarify the neurological changes before and after whole vault cranioplasty (WVC) in patients born with sagittal craniosynostosis.

item.title: Task-induced brain state manipulation improves prediction of individual traits
item.description: Abstract Recent work has begun to relate individual differences in brain functional organization to human behaviors and cognition, but the best brain state to reveal such relationships remains an open question.

item.title: Trait paranoia shapes inter-subject synchrony in brain activity during an ambiguous social narrative
item.description: Abstract Individuals often interpret the same event in different ways. How do personality traits modulate brain activity evoked by a complex stimulus?

item.title: Data-Driven Analysis of Functional Connectivity Reveals a Potential Auditory Verbal Hallucination Network
item.description: Abstract The effect of life stress on depression is moderated by a repeat length variation in the transcriptional control region of the serotonin transporter gene, which renders carriers of the short variant vulnerable for depression.

item.title: Presurgical language fMRI: Clinical practices and patient outcomes in epilepsy surgical planning
item.description: Abstract The goal of this study was to document current clinical practice and report patient outcomes in presurgical language functional MRI (fMRI) for epilepsy surgery.

item.title: Humans with obesity have disordered brain responses to food images during physiological hyperglycemia
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Hypoglycemia unawareness in type 1 diabetes suppresses brain responses to hypoglycemia
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Among nondiabetic individuals, mild glucose decrements alter brain activity in regions linked to reward, motivation, and executive control.

item.title: Resting-state functional connectivity predicts neuroticism and extraversion in novel individuals
item.description: Abstract The personality dimensions of neuroticism and extraversion are strongly associated with emotional experience and affective disorders.

item.title: Considering factors affecting the connectome-based identification process: Comment on Waller et al
item.description: Abstract A recent study by Waller and colleagues evaluated the reliability, specificity, and generalizability of using functional connectivity data to identify individuals from a group.

item.title: Connectome-based predictive modeling of attention: Comparing different functional connectivity features and prediction methods across datasets
item.description: Abstract Connectome-based predictive modeling (CPM; Finn et al., 2015; Shen et al.

item.title: The NAIMS cooperative pilot project: Design, implementation and future directions
item.description: Abstract The North American Imaging in Multiple Sclerosis (NAIMS) Cooperative represents a network of 27 academic centers focused on accelerating the pace of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) research in multiple sclerosis (MS) through idea exchange and collaboration.

item.title: Connectome-based Models Predict Separable Components of Attention in Novel Individuals
item.description: Abstract Active coping underlies a healthy stress response, but neural processes supporting such resilient coping are not well-known.

item.title: Influences on the Test-Retest Reliability of Functional Connectivity MRI and its Relationship with Behavioral Utility
item.description: Abstract Best practices are currently being developed for the acquisition and processing of resting-state magnetic resonance imaging data used to estimate brain functional organization-or “functional connectivity.

item.title: Altered functional connectivity to stressful stimuli in prenatally cocaine-exposed adolescents
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: An exemplar-based approach to individualized parcellation reveals the need for sex specific functional networks
item.description: Abstract Recent work with functional connectivity data has led to significant progress in understanding the functional organization of the brain.

item.title: Gradient nonlinearity effects on upper cervical spinal cord area measurement from 3D T(1) -weighted brain MRI acquisitions
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVE: The aim of this study was to explore the relationship between global brain activity, changes in whole-brain connectivity, and changes in brain states across subjects using resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging.

item.title: Presurgical language fMRI: Mapping of six critical regions
item.description: Abstract Language mapping is a key goal in neurosurgical planning. fMRI mapping typically proceeds with a focus on Broca’s and Wernicke’s areas, although multiple other language-critical areas are now well-known.

item.title: Can brain state be manipulated to emphasize individual differences in functional connectivity?
item.description: Abstract While neuroimaging studies typically collapse data from many subjects, brain functional organization varies between individuals, and characterizing this variability is crucial for relating brain activity to behavioral phenotypes.

item.title: Shared microstructural features of behavioral and substance addictions revealed in areas of crossing fibers
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Topographic organization of the cerebral cortex and brain cartography
item.description: Abstract One of the most specific but also challenging properties of the brain is its topographic organization into distinct modules or cortical areas.

item.title: Using connectome-based predictive modeling to predict individual behavior from brain connectivity
item.description: Abstract Neuroimaging is a fast-developing research area in which anatomical and functional images of human brains are collected using techniques such as functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI), diffusion tensor imaging (DTI), and electroencephalography (EEG).

item.title: Gray-matter relationships to diagnostic and transdiagnostic features of drug and behavioral addictions
item.description: Abstract Alterations in neural structure have been reported in both cocaine-use disorder and gambling disorder, separately, suggesting similarities across addiction diagnoses.

item.title: Multi-modal analysis of functional connectivity and cerebral blood flow reveals shared and unique effects of propofol in large-scale brain networks
item.description: Abstract Anesthesia-induced changes in functional connectivity and cerebral blow flow (CBF) in large-scale brain networks have emerged as key markers of reduced consciousness.

item.title: Weak functional connectivity in the human fetal brain prior to preterm birth
item.description: Abstract It has been suggested that neurological problems more frequent in those born preterm are expressed prior to birth, but owing to technical limitations, this has been difficult to test in humans.

item.title: Cingulate cortex functional connectivity predicts future relapse in alcohol dependent individuals
item.description: Abstract Alcohol dependence is a chronic relapsing illness. Alcohol and stress cues have consistently been shown to increase craving and relapse risk in recovering alcohol dependent (AUD) patients.

item.title: O-space with high resolution readouts outperforms radial imaging
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: While O-Space imaging is well known to accelerate image acquisition beyond traditional Cartesian sampling, its advantages compared to undersampled radial imaging, the linear trajectory most akin to O-Space imaging, have not been detailed.

item.title: Reorganization of brain connectivity in obesity
item.description: Abstract Global brain connectivity (GBC) identifies regions of the brain, termed “hubs,” which are densely connected and metabolically costly, and have a wide influence on brain function.

item.title: Impaired consciousness in patients with absence seizures investigated by functional MRI, EEG, and behavioural measures: a cross-sectional study
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: The central vein sign and its clinical evaluation for the diagnosis of multiple sclerosis: a consensus statement from the North American Imaging in Multiple Sclerosis Cooperative
item.description: Abstract Over the past few years, MRI has become an indispensable tool for diagnosing multiple sclerosis (MS).

item.title: Individual variation in functional brain connectivity: implications for personalized approaches to psychiatric disease
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Multisite reliability of MR-based functional connectivity
item.description: Abstract Recent years have witnessed an increasing number of multisite MRI functional connectivity (fcMRI) studies.

item.title: The Localization of Long-Distance Dependency Components: Integrating the Focal-lesion and Neuroimaging Record
item.description: Abstract In the sentence “The captain who the sailor greeted is tall,” the connection between the relative pronoun and the object position of greeted represents a long-distance dependency (LDD), necessary for the interpretation of “the captain” as the individual being greeted.

item.title: Does prenatal stress alter the developing connectome?
item.description: Abstract Human neurodevelopment requires the organization of neural elements into complex structural and functional networks called the connectome.

item.title: Methylphenidate Modulates Functional Network Connectivity to Enhance Attention
item.description: Abstract Recent work has demonstrated that human whole-brain functional connectivity patterns measured with fMRI contain information about cognitive abilities, including sustained attention.

item.title: Prenatal stress alters amygdala functional connectivity in preterm neonates
item.description: Abstract Exposure to prenatal and early-life stress results in alterations in neural connectivity and an increased risk for neuropsychiatric disorders.

item.title: Altered Brain Response to Drinking Glucose and Fructose in Obese Adolescents
item.description: Abstract Increased sugar-sweetened beverage consumption has been linked to higher rates of obesity.

item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Functional Connectivity During Exposure to Favorite-Food, Stress, and Neutral-Relaxing Imagery Differs Between Smokers and Nonsmokers
item.description: Abstract INTRODUCTION: Tobacco-use disorder is a complex condition involving multiple brain networks and presenting with multiple behavioral correlates including changes in diet and stress.

item.title: Language at rest: A longitudinal study of intrinsic functional connectivity in preterm children
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Preterm (PT) children show early cognitive and language deficits and display altered cortical connectivity for language compared to term (T) children.

item.title: Metonymy as Referential Dependency: Psycholinguistic and Neurolinguistic Arguments for a Unified Linguistic Treatment
item.description: Abstract We examine metonymy at psycho- and neurolinguistic levels, seeking to adjudicate between two possible processing implementations (one- vs.

item.title: Diffusion Tensor Imaging in Patients with Glioblastoma Multiforme Using the Supertoroidal Model
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) is a powerful imaging technique that has led to improvements in the diagnosis and prognosis of cerebral lesions and neurosurgical guidance for tumor resection.

item.title: Normalization of brain morphology after surgery in sagittal craniosynostosis
item.description: Abstract OBJECT Nonsyndromic craniosynostosis (NSC) is associated with significant learning disability later in life.

item.title: The Role of Nonlinear Gradients in Parallel Imaging: A k-Space Based Analysis
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: A neuromarker of sustained attention from whole-brain functional connectivity
item.description: Abstract Although attention plays a ubiquitous role in perception and cognition, researchers lack a simple way to measure a person’s overall attentional abilities.

item.title: Alterations in Anatomical Covariance in the Prematurely Born
item.description: Abstract Preterm (PT) birth results in long-term alterations in functional and structural connectivity, but the related changes in anatomical covariance are just beginning to be explored.

item.title: Functional connectome fingerprinting: identifying individuals using patterns of brain connectivity
item.description: Abstract Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies typically collapse data from many subjects, but brain functional organization varies between individuals.

item.title: Preterm birth alters neonatal, functional rich club organization
item.description: Abstract Alterations in neural networks are associated with the cognitive difficulties of the prematurely born.

item.title: The (in)stability of functional brain network measures across thresholds
item.description: Abstract The large-scale organization of the brain has features of complex networks that can be quantified using network measures from graph theory.

item.title: Experimental O-space turbo spin echo imaging
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Prenatal cocaine exposure (PCE) is linked to addiction and obesity vulnerability.

item.title: Fast rotary nonlinear spatial acquisition (FRONSAC) imaging
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: Nonlinear spatial encoding magnetic fields (SEMs) have been studied to reconstruct images from a minimum number of echoes.

item.title: Meditation leads to reduced default mode network activity beyond an active task
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Reliability of an fMRI paradigm for emotional processing in a multisite longitudinal study
item.description: Abstract Multisite neuroimaging studies can facilitate the investigation of brain-related changes in many contexts, including patient groups that are relatively rare in the general population.

item.title: Predicting moment-to-moment attentional state
item.description: Abstract Although fluctuations in sustained attention are ubiquitous, most psychological experiments treat them as noise, averaging performance over many trials.

item.title: 2D Magnetic resonance electrical property tomography based on B1(-) field mapping
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Adaptive mechanisms of developing brain: cerebral lateralization in the prematurely-born
item.description: Abstract Preterm birth results in alterations in neural connectivity, but the impact of prematurity on the functional organization of the developing brain has yet to be explored.

item.title: Sex differences in normal age trajectories of functional brain networks
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Similarities between behavioral and substance addictions exist. However, direct neurobiological comparison between addictive disorders is rare.

item.title: Altered functional connectivity in seizure onset zones revealed by fMRI intrinsic connectivity
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVE: The purpose of this study was to investigate functional connectivity (FC) changes in epileptogenic networks in intractable partial epilepsy obtained from resting-state fMRI by using intrinsic connectivity contrast (ICC), a voxel-based network measure of degree that reflects the number of connections to each voxel.

item.title: BioImage Suite: An integrated medical image analysis suite: An update
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Radiofrequency pulse design using nonlinear gradient magnetic fields
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: An iterative k-space trajectory and radiofrequency (RF) pulse design method is proposed for excitation using nonlinear gradient magnetic fields.

item.title: Leptin is associated with exaggerated brain reward and emotion responses to food images in adolescent obesity
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVE: In the U.S., an astonishing 12.5 million children and adolescents are now obese, predisposing 17% of our nation’s youth to metabolic complications of obesity, such as type 2 diabetes (T2D).

item.title: Pseudo-random center placement O-space imaging for improved incoherence compressed sensing parallel MRI
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: GABA, resting-state connectivity and the developing brain
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Preclinical data demonstrate that gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) interneurons initiate connectivity in the developing brain.

item.title: BOLD signal and functional connectivity associated with loving kindness meditation
item.description: Abstract Loving kindness is a form of meditation involving directed well-wishing, typically supported by the silent repetition of phrases such as “may all beings be happy,” to foster a feeling of selfless love.

item.title: Algebraic reconstruction technique for parallel imaging reconstruction of undersampled radial data: application to cardiac cine
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: To investigate algebraic reconstruction technique (ART) for parallel imaging reconstruction of radial data, applied to accelerated cardiac cine.

item.title: Altered brain connectivity in sagittal craniosynostosis
item.description: Abstract OBJECT: Sagittal nonsyndromic craniosynostosis (sNSC) is the most common form of NSC.

item.title: Coupled Intrinsic Connectivity Distribution analysis: a method for exploratory connectivity analysis of paired FMRI data
item.description: Abstract We present a novel voxel-based connectivity approach for paired functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) data collected under two different conditions labeled the Coupled Intrinsic Connectivity Distribution (coupled-ICD).

item.title: The impact of image smoothness on intrinsic functional connectivity and head motion confounds
item.description: Abstract We present a novel method for controlling the effects of group differences in motion on functional connectivity studies.

item.title: Modulating intrinsic connectivity: adjacent subregions within supplementary motor cortex, dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, and parietal cortex connect to separate functional networks during task and also connect during rest

item.title: Functional MRI signal fluctuations: a preclinical biomarker for cognitive impairment in type 2 diabetes?

item.title: Single echo MRI

item.title: Multiecho acquisition of O-space data
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: Nonlinear gradient encoding methods, such as O-Space imaging, have been shown to provide good images from very few echoes.

item.title: Cerebral Lateralization is Protective in the Very Prematurely Born
item.description: Abstract Individuals born prematurely are at risk for developmental delay, and converging data suggest alterations in neural networks in the developing preterm brain.

item.title: A preliminary investigation of Stroop-related intrinsic connectivity in cocaine dependence: associations with treatment outcomes
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Noninvasive MRI measurement of the absolute cerebral blood volume-cerebral blood flow relationship during visual stimulation in healthy humans
item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: The relationship between cerebral blood volume (CBV) and cerebral blood flow (CBF) underlies blood oxygenation level-dependent functional MRI signal.

item.title: Disruption of functional networks in dyslexia: a whole-brain, data-driven analysis of connectivity
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Functional connectivity analyses of functional magnetic resonance imaging data are a powerful tool for characterizing brain networks and how they are disrupted in neural disorders.

item.title: Reliability of neuroanatomical measurements in a multisite longitudinal study of youth at risk for psychosis
item.description: Abstract Multisite longitudinal neuroimaging designs are used to identify differential brain structural change associated with onset or progression of disease.

item.title: A feasibility study of magnetic resonance driven electrical impedance tomography using a phantom
item.description: Abstract To be imported ..

item.title: Real-time fMRI links subjective experience with brain activity during focused attention
item.description: Abstract Recent advances in brain imaging have improved the measure of neural processes related to perceptual, cognitive and affective functions, yet the relation between brain activity and subjective experience remains poorly characterized.

item.title: Disrupted ventromedial prefrontal function, alcohol craving, and subsequent relapse risk
item.description: Abstract IMPORTANCE: Alcohol dependence is a chronic relapsing illness; stress, alcohol-related cues, and neutral-relaxing states significantly influence craving and relapse risk.

item.title: A left cerebellar pathway mediates language in prematurely-born young adults
item.description: Abstract Sequences that encode the spatial information of an object using nonlinear gradient fields are a new frontier in MRI, with potential to provide lower peripheral nerve stimulation, windowed fields of view, tailored spatially-varying resolution, curved slices that mirror physiological geometry, and, most importantly, very fast parallel imaging with multichannel coils.

item.title: Intrinsic brain connectivity related to age in young and middle aged adults
item.description: Abstract Age-related variations in resting state connectivity of the human brain were examined from young adulthood through middle age.

item.title: Does baseline cerebral blood flow affect task-related blood oxygenation level dependent response in schizophrenia?
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Experimental changes in resting cerebral blood flow (CBF) affect task-related blood oxygenation level dependent (BOLD) responses.

item.title: Ipsilateral synkinesia involves the supplementary motor area
item.description: Abstract The supplementary motor area coordinates movements. Synkinesia is a rare disorder in which an involuntary movement occurs coordinated with a voluntary movement.

item.title: The relationship between phonological and auditory processing and brain organization in beginning readers
item.description: Abstract We employed brain-behavior analyses to explore the relationship between performance on tasks measuring phonological awareness, pseudoword decoding, and rapid auditory processing (all predictors of reading (dis)ability) and brain organization for print and speech in beginning readers.

item.title: Real-time fMRI biofeedback targeting the orbitofrontal cortex for contamination anxiety
item.description: Abstract We present a method for training subjects to control activity in a region of their orbitofrontal cortex associated with contamination anxiety using biofeedback of real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging (rt-fMRI) data.

item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: The pathophysiology of auditory verbal hallucinations remains poorly understood.

item.title: Functional connectivity between task-positive and task-negative brain areas and its relation to working memory performance
item.description: Abstract Functional brain imaging studies have identified a set of brain areas typically activated during cognitive tasks (task-positive brain areas) and another set of brain areas typically deactivated during cognitive tasks (task-negative brain areas).

item.title: Functional connectivity to a right hemisphere language center in prematurely born adolescents
item.description: Abstract Prematurely born children are at increased risk for language deficits at school age and beyond, but the neurobiological basis of these findings remains poorly understood.

item.title: Unification of sentence processing via ear and eye: an fMRI study
item.description: Abstract We present new evidence based on fMRI for the existence and neural architecture of an abstract supramodal language system that can integrate linguistic inputs arising from different modalities such that speech and print each activate a common code.

item.title: Surgically implantable magnetic resonance angiography coils improve resolution to allow visualization of blood flow dynamics
item.description: Abstract BACKGROUND: Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) is clinically useful but of limited applicability to small animal models due to poor signal resolution, with typical voxel sizes of 1 mm(3) that are insufficient to analyze vessels of diameter <1 mm.

item.description: Abstract This work examines the influence of changes in baseline activity on the intrinsic functional connectivity fMRI (fc-fMRI) in humans.

item.title: Similar and dissociable mechanisms for attention to internal versus external information
item.description: Abstract We compared two attentional executive processes: updating, which involved attending to a perceptually present stimulus, and refreshing, which involved attending to a mentally active representation of a stimulus no longer perceptually present.

item.description: Abstract Converging data suggest recovery from injury in the preterm brain.

item.description: Abstract PURPOSE: This work examines the efficacy of functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) for language lateralization using a comprehensive three-task language-mapping approach.

item.title: Glucose dysregulation and hepatic steatosis in obese adolescents: is there a link?
item.description: Abstract Fatty liver is increasingly common in obese adolescents. We determined its association with glucose dysregulation in 118 (37M/81F) obese adolescents of similar age and percent total fat.

item.title: Functional and structural connectivity between the perigenual anterior cingulate and amygdala in bipolar disorder
item.description: Abstract OBJECTIVE: Abnormalities in the morphology and function of two gray matter structures central to emotional processing, the perigenual anterior cingulate cortex (pACC) and amygdala, have consistently been reported in bipolar disorder (BD).

item.title: More accurate Talairach coordinates for neuroimaging using non-linear registration
item.description: Abstract While the Talairach atlas remains the most commonly used system for reporting coordinates in neuroimaging studies, the absence of an actual 3-D image of the original brain used in its construction has severely limited the ability of researchers to automatically map locations from 3-D anatomical MRI images to the atlas.

item.description: Abstract Individual differences in brain response to emotional stimuli have previously been associated with gene variations within the serotonin transporter (5-HTT) and tryptophan hydroxylase-2 (TPH2) genes.

item.description: Abstract Hepatic fat fraction (HFF) was measured in 28 lean/obese humans by single-voxel proton spectroscopy (MRS), a two-point Dixon (2PD), and a three-point iterative decomposition of water and fat with echo asymmetry and least-squares estimation (IDEAL) method (3PI).
